automatic_ordering.reasoning: AtPier_01 appears to represent an initial, neutral encounter with a Duergar guard at the lakeside entrance to Ketheric City. In this session nothing special is triggered, so it likely occurs as the normal first meeting with the duergar. AtPier_02, on the other hand, contains several detailed trigger instructions that depend on multiple conditions (e.g. having met the guard, as well as later events such as Nere being killed, mutiny occurring, or a deepgnome tag being active). In practical gameplay these different conditions lead to modified dialogue or state—in effect, AtPier_02 represents a follow‐up encounter where the duergar’s response depends on which flag is set. In other words, the player should first experience AtPier_01 (the standard encounter) and only later, once one or more of the flags have been set (triggered by prior events, such as finishing the first dialog and talking to Cleric Morghal, then using recon commands) will AtPier_02 be encountered. Moreover, the various triggers available inside AtPier_02 (the greeting for having met the guard, the “Nere Killed” branch, the “Mutiny happened” branch, and the “Greeting (Deepgnome tag)” branch) cannot occur at the same time in the same playthrough. They are mutually exclusive states, meaning that the actions that set one flag preclude the others.
